feat.name: Aberrant Dragonmark
entries: You have manifested an aberrant dragonmark. Determine its appearance and the flaw associated with it. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn a {@filter cantrip of your choice from the sorcerer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Sorcerer}. In addition, choose a {@filter 1st-level spell from the sorcerer spell list|spells|level=1|class=Sorcerer}. You learn that spell and can cast it through your mark. Once you cast it, you must finish a short or long rest before you can cast it again through the mark. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

When you cast the 1st-level spell through your mark, you can expend one of your Hit Dice and roll it. If you roll an even number, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the number rolled. If you roll an odd number, one random creature within 30 feet of you (not including you) takes force damage equal to the number rolled. If no other creatures are in range, you take the damage.

entries: You also develop a random flaw from the Aberrant Dragonmark Flaws table.

entries.caption: Aberrant Dragonmark Flaws
rows: Your mark is a source of constant physical pain.
Your mark whispers to you. Its meaning can be unclear.
When you're stressed, the mark hisses audibly.
The skin around the mark is burned, scaly, or withered.
You have a mood swing any time you use your mark.
Your looks change slightly whenever you use the mark.
You have horrific nightmares after you use your mark.

feat.name: Actor
entries: Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Deception}) and Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person.

You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check contested by your Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.
When you hear someone speak, you can, with a successful Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check...

feat.name: Artificer Initiate
entries: You've learned some of an artificer's inventiveness:

items: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the {@filter artificer spell list|spells|level=0;1|class=artificer}, and you learn one 1st-level spell of your choice from {@filter that list|spells|level=0;1|class=artificer}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
You can cast this feat's 1st-level spell without a spell slot, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have.

You gain proficiency with one type of {@filter artisan's tools|items|type=artisan's tools} of your choice, and you can use that type of tool as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses Intelligence as its spellcasting ability.

feat.name: Tavern Brawler
entries: Accustomed to rough-and-tumble fighting using whatever weapons happen to be at hand, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are proficient with improvised weapons.
Your unarmed strike uses a {@damage d4} for damage.
Your attacks using improvised weapons use a {@damage d6} for damage.
You treat improvised weapons as finesse weapons.
When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike or an improvised weapon on your turn, you can use a bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.

feat.name: Telekinetic
entries: You learn to move things with your mind, granting you the following benefits:

items: Chose Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma.

You learn the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. You can cast it without verbal or somatic components, and you can make the spectral hand {@condition invisible}. If you already know this spell, its range increases by 30 feet when you cast it. Its spellcasting ability is the ability chosen by this feat.

As a bonus action, you can try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. When you do so, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + the ability modifier of the score chosen by this feat) or be moved 5 feet toward you or away from you. A creature can willingly fail this save.

feat.name: Telepathic
entries: You awaken the ability to mentally connect with others, granting you the following benefits:

items: Choose Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

You can speak telepathically to any creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Your telepathic utterances are in a language you know, and the creature understands you only if it knows that language. Your communication doesn't give the creature the ability to respond to you telepathically.

You can cast the {@spell detect thoughts} spell, requiring no spell slot or components, and you must finish a long rest before you can cast it this way again. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability chosen by this feat. If you have spell slots of 2nd level or higher, you can cast this spell with them.

feat.name: War Caster
entries: You have practiced casting spells in the midst of combat, learning techniques that grant you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage.
You can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a {@item shield|phb} in one or both hands.

When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, rather than making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must target only that creature.

feat.name: Weapon Master
entries: You have practiced extensively with a variety of weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with four weapons of your choice. Each one must be a simple or a martial weapon.
You gain proficiency with shields.

feat.name: Battlemage
entries: You are trained in casting spells while fighting close to an enemy. You gain the following benefits:

items: You no longer have disadvantage due to making a ranged spell attack while adjacent to an enemy.
You may use a weapon you are wielding as a spellcasting focus.

feat.name: All Out Attack
entries: You fight with reckless abandon, caring little for your own safety. You may die one day – but that day will come sooner to your enemies.

items: At the end of your turn you can enter a stance prepared for striking at anyone who comes near. You can subtract your proficiency bonus from your AC until the start of your next turn. When a creature within your reach hits you with a melee attack, you may use your reaction to make an attack against that creature.

feat.name: Bulwark
entries: Standing still, feet on the ground, your defenses become impenetrable.

items: At the start of your turn, you can reduce your speed to 0. If you do so you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on a melee attack made against you before the start of your next turn.
When an effect causes you to move without expending your movement, you can reduce the movement by 5ft

feat.name: Deadly Cunning
entries: You are uncommonly nimble for your race. You gain the following benefits:

items: When casting a cantrip that requires an attack roll and causes damage to a single target, or when you make an unarmed or improvised weapon attack, if you have advantage, you can add your Sneak Attack damage as if you were wielding a finesse or ranged weapon.

feat.name: Demolitionist
entries: Destroying something is easy. Demolishing it is art

items: You get advantge when making attacks against an object.
When making an attack against an object or construct, your attack critically strike on rolls of 19 or 20 and ignore half of the damage resistance the target has.
You have advantage on saving throws and ability check to avoid falling rubble or collapsing ground.

feat.name: Arena Fighter
entries: Some fight to kill, some fight to survive. You fight to put on a show.

items: You gain proficiency with the {@weapon net}, {@weapon trident}, {@weapon flail}, {@weapon morningstar}, {@weapon scimitar}, {@weapon whip}, and{@armor shield}
When making an attack with the {@weapon net}, you dont have Disadvantage from using the Net's long range.
When making a ranged attack against a target within 5ft of you, you don't get Disadvantage from attacking with an enemy in melee.

feat.name: Man of the Sea
entries: You find life at sea a second nature.

items: You gain proficiency with the {@weapon net} and {@weapon trident}
When you make a ranged attack with the {@weapon net} or {@weapon trident} against a target within 10ft of you and miss, you may immediately recover the thrown weapon.
You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
You have advantage on {@skill athletics} and {@skill acrobatics} checks associated with water or ships.

feat.name: Beastmaster
entries: You know the workings of beasts. You know what drives them and what pleases them. And you know exactly what scares them

items: When using a Whip, your weapon damage die is increased to {@damage d6}.
You gain proficiency in either the {@skill animal handling} skill or {@skill nature} skill
You have advantage on checks made to track Beasts.

When you attack a beast you may use your bonus action to deter it from attacking a target. Designate a target. If the beast fails Wisdom (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) save, it has disadvantage when attacking the target until the end of your next turn.
